title: European Commission vice president responsible for values: Ukraine accession negotiations must be opened 'without delay'
summary: In an interview, Vera Jourova also said that the European Union is partly responsible for the rise of the far right on the continent.

title: Police in Paris arrest a man who targeted passersby, killing 1, injuring 2 others, official says
summary: A German tourist was killed in the attack, which happened near the Eiffel Tower.

title: Bombs rain down on southern Gaza, where the Israeli army is now extending its offensive
summary: After a week's truce, the Khan Yunis and Rafah areas were bombarded. At least 200 Palestinians have been killed since fighting resumed, according to the local Ministry of Health.

title: Burkina Faso suspends French daily 'Le Monde'
summary: Retaliatory move comes after the newspaper published an article about a jihadist attack last month.

title: Israel-Hamas: Netanyahu's headlong rush into war
summary: Obsessed with his political survival, the Israeli prime minister rejects the idea of a Palestinian state and offers only alternative solutions for the future of the coastal enclave.

title: In Dubai, Macron bears the brunt of Arab leaders' irritation over Gaza
summary: The French president, who attended COP28, was unable to organize the round table he had planned with representatives of the governments most concerned by the war between Israel and Hamas.

title: Nations rally behind renewables at COP28 climate talks
summary: More than 110 nations pledged to triple the world's renewable energy within seven years.

title: In Istanbul, the disturbing disappearance of Syrian opposition figure and refugee Ahmed Katie
summary: The human rights activist, who was about to move to France with his family, has not appeared in public since November 27, when he had an appointment with members of the Turkish security services.

title: 'Moms for Liberty' launch their conservative crusade against American schools
summary: The US organization is appealing to the American right and to candidates in the Republican primaries, but is struggling to win over parents and gain representation on school boards.

title: X, a field of investigation emptied of researchers
summary: The move to a fee-based API model – announced on February 2 but recently implemented – has raised concerns in the research community. This change has multiple implications for the work of academics.

title: Russian activists form resistance networks against Putin and the war in Ukraine
summary: Russian civilians are organizing in order to help army deserters, political prisoners and Ukrainians. They met in Brussels for an 'Anti-War Initiatives Congress.'

title: 'Climate change is an immediate issue, not one for the end of the century'
summary: Extreme weather events illustrate the violence of climate change already underway while proving the urgent need to overhaul our societies and lifestyles.

title: NATO: Erdogan, a recalcitrant ally with a risky strategy
summary: Despite a commitment made in July, Turkey has still not ratified Sweden's entry into NATO. In recent years, the Turkish president and his allies have been at loggerheads over Syria, Russia, Hamas and the modernization of Turkey's fighter jets.

title: In Ukraine, the dark daily lives of the residents in territories liberated a year ago
summary: Whether bombings, mines or unemployment, the challenges are countless, observes the Ukrainian NGO East SOS, just back from a mission to the Kherson, Kharkiv, Mykolaiv and Donetsk regions.

title: COP28: Heads of state call for action but remain divided on fossil fuels
summary: The countries meeting in Dubai for the 28th World Climate Conference have begun negotiating an initial working document, which contains a range of options from simply banning new coal-fired power plants to phasing out all fossil fuels.

title: Disney boss calls on creators to focus on 'entertainment,' not political 'message'
summary: Bob Iger gave his mea culpa on Wednesday. Criticized for the firm's latest films – which contained more political messages than original ideas – the 72-year-old CEO admitted that quality and commercial results were not up to scratch.

title: George Santos expelled from the US House of Representatives
summary: The Republican lawmaker who lied his way into Congress by falsifying his background, family and personal life was ousted from office in a landmark vote on Friday.

title: COP28's first day hails the 'loss and damage' fund's implementation as an important step forward
summary: At the opening of the climate conference in Dubai, governments unexpectedly adopted a framework for setting up a fund to help the most vulnerable countries.

title: Israel-Hamas war: The frustrations and discreet solidarity of the Palestinian diaspora in the United Arab Emirates
summary: In a country which normalized relations with Israel in 2020, and where freedom of expression is severely restricted, Palestinians are organizing collections for Gaza as an alternative to street mobilization.

title: Gavin Newsom's unwavering support for Biden is a way to secure his political ambitions
summary: On Thursday, November 30, the 56-year-old Democratic governor from California faced off against his Florida counterpart, Republican Ron DeSantis, in a televised debate that had no stakes but still formed a part of the 2024 White House race.

title: What France's fast-food restaurants say about the country
summary: The increasing presence of fast food restaurants in some streets and towns illustrates the urban changes, income inequality and business creation opportunities in working-class neighborhoods.

title: Italy and Spain to meet in Euro 2024 group stage, England handed kind draw
summary: The competition will be held in Germany from June 14 to July 14, 2024.

title: Montreal's organized crime scene in turmoil
summary: Bloody settlements of scores between rival clans have been escalating since the death of the Montreal mafia's godfather, who had managed to organize the criminal underworld.

title: Guinea-Bissau president calls deadly violence earlier this week 'attempted coup'
summary: At least two people were killed in clashes between the National Guard and forces of the presidential guard.

title: Paris attack: What we know about Armand R., who killed one and injured others near the Eiffel Tower
summary: Known to authorities for his radical Islamism and psychiatric problems, this Frenchman had already been arrested and sentenced for a planned attack in the Paris area.

title: Macron lists France's priorities for tackling climate change at COP28
summary: France has launched an initiative to end private financing of new coal-fired power plants and signed a declaration to triple nuclear capacity by 2050.

title: Burkina Faso: Le Monde condemns government accusations and its suspension in the country
summary: After publishing an article on a jihadist attack, the authorities in Burkina Faso described our work as 'biased.' Le Monde defends the seriousness and independence of its investigation and deplores the sanctions taken by the Burkinabe regime against several media outlets.

title: Nantes football fan dies after stabbing before Ligue 1 game
summary: The fatality occurred when several vehicles transporting Nice supporters were attacked by rival Nantes fans while on their way to the Beaujoire stadium before Saturday's game.

title: Israel-Hamas war: In Tel Aviv's 'Hostage Square,' euphoria has given way to fear
summary: Relatives of Israelis still held captive by Hamas in Gaza are trying to keep up the pressure on the government, despite renewed fighting.

title: Bangladesh faces its worst dengue epidemic on record
summary: Characterized in Bangladesh by long erratic monsoons and higher temperatures, climate change is promoting the reproduction of 'Aedes' mosquitoes, the main vectors of dengue fever, which this year caused over 1,600 deaths.

title: Paris attack: How the terrorist's confusing profile fooled those monitoring him
summary: Already convicted of terrorism in 2018, Armand R.-M. kept telling investigators and those close to him that he had 'de-radicalized.' His psychiatric problems and the monitoring he had received since his prison release are at the heart of the interrogations. He stopped taking his medication in March 2022.
